page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY-BREDICOT,ETC.
page.content: {Place names}-Bredicot derives from Brada's Cot, Brada being the name of the owner of a small cottage there, in Anglo-Saxon times. Churchill appears self explanatory but may mean a hill with a burial mound, having derived from the Celtic word "ciric" meaning a burial mound. Spetchley means a place for making speeches in a forest clearing made by an Anglo-Saxon chieftain. { {Bredicot}-well-researched by a local historian, was formerly a Roman Settlement. It became part of the Royal Forest until the 14th century and was the property of the Prior at Worcester Cathedral. The tiny{chapel of St James the Less was built in the 13th century. After the Civil War, Bredicot was sold and only returned to the Cathedral at the Restoration It now mostly belongs to the estate.
